intro: Jasione dentata f. integrifolia, commonly known as the smoothleaf bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Campanulaceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of lanceolate, hairy leaves that are smooth-edged, distinguishing it from other forms of Jasione dentata. The plant produces blue to violet bell-shaped flowers that bloom in summer, typically in clusters at the ends of its stems. It is native to southern Europe and is often found in rocky or gravelly soils. This species is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its attractive foliage and flowers.
